Section 1: Personal and Employment Infor: What is your full legal name?
What is your current address and contact information?
What were your employment dates (start and end)?
What is the full legal name of your employer/company?
How many employees does/did the company have (must be 15+ for EEOC jurisdiction)?
What is the company's physical address where you worked?
Who is the HR Director/Supervisor (name and contact information)?
Is the company owned by a larger corporation (e.g., State Farm)?
Section 2: Disability and Protected Clas: What is your disability diagnosis? (e.g., Autism Spectrum Disorder)
Who provided your diagnosis (healthcare provider name)?
Do you have medical documentation supporting your disability?
How does your disability substantially limit major life activities?
Did you disclose your disability to your employer? If yes, when and to whom?
Have you received accommodations in previous employment or educational settings?
Are there any other protected class characteristics relevant to your case (age, race, sex, religion, national origin)?
Section 3: Performance History (2021-202: What was your overall performance rating in 2021?
Describe specific achievements and positive feedback received in 2021.
What was your overall performance rating in 2022?
Describe specific achievements and positive feedback received in 2022.
What was your overall performance rating in 2023?
Describe specific achievements and positive feedback received in 2023.
Did you receive any promotions, bonuses, or awards during 2021-2023?
Were you considered a high performer or leader during this period?
Did you receive any disciplinary actions during 2021-2023?
What were your primary job responsibilities during 2021-2023?
Section 4: The 2024 Complaint (Protected: On what date did you file your formal discrimination complaint?
What was the nature of your complaint (discrimination, harassment, hostile environment)?
To whom did you submit the complaint (HR, supervisor, specific person)?
Was the complaint submitted in writing? Do you have a copy?
What specific issues did you raise in the complaint?
Did you mention your disability in the complaint?
What response, if any, did you receive to your complaint?
How long after the complaint did adverse actions begin?
Did anyone acknowledge receipt of your complaint?
Section 5: Reasonable Accommodation Requ: Did you request reasonable accommodations for your disability? If yes, when?
What specific accommodations did you request?
How did you submit the accommodation request (verbal, written, email)?
Do you have documentation of your accommodation request?
Did the employer request medical documentation? If yes, did you provide it?
Did the employer engage in an interactive process with you to discuss accommodations?
Were any accommodations provided? If yes, what and when?
Were the accommodations effective in allowing you to perform your job duties?
Did the employer deny any requested accommodations? If yes, what reason was given?
How long did the employer take to respond to your accommodation request?
Was the accommodation request ignored or not followed up on?
Did you clearly communicate how your disability affected your ability to perform job functions?
Section 6: Retaliatory Actions and Hosti: Describe how the workplace environment changed after your 2024 complaint.
What adverse employment actions did you experience after the complaint?
Were your job responsibilities changed or reduced? If yes, describe specifically.
Were you held to different standards than similarly situated employees?
Were you assigned duties outside your pay band or job description?
How were audit objectives or internal processes altered to affect you?
Were you excluded from meetings, projects, or opportunities?
Did you experience verbal harassment, mockery, or derogatory comments?
Who were the individuals involved in the retaliatory conduct?
What was the timing of each adverse action relative to your complaint?
Did you receive sudden negative performance reviews after the complaint?
Were you subject to increased scrutiny or micromanagement?
Did you witness other employees in similar situations treated more favorably?
Were there any witnesses to the retaliatory conduct?
Do you have emails, texts, or other documentation of the hostile environment?
Section 7: 2024 Performance Review Chang: What was your overall performance rating in 2024?
How does your 2024 rating compare to your 2021-2023 ratings?
When was your 2024 performance review conducted (before or after the complaint)?
What specific criticisms were included in the 2024 review?
Were you given notice of performance issues before the 2024 review?
Did the 2024 review reference issues never mentioned to you before?
Were the performance standards applied to you consistent with those applied to others?
Do you have evidence contradicting the negative findings in the 2024 review?
Was the 2024 review used to justify adverse employment actions?
Section 8: Mark Hayes and Leadership Cha: Who is Mark Hayes and what was his role?
When did Mark Hayes leave the company?
What was your relationship with Mark Hayes (supervisor, mentor, etc.)?
How did the work environment change after Mark Hayes left?
Who replaced Mark Hayes or took over his responsibilities?
Did the retaliatory conduct increase after Mark Hayes's departure?
Did Mark Hayes provide you with positive feedback or support?
Do you have documentation of Mark Hayes's support or positive assessments of your work?
Section 9: Severance Offer and Terminati: Were you offered a severance package? If yes, when?
What were the terms of the severance offer (amount, duration of benefits)?
Did the severance agreement include a release or waiver of claims?
Why did you decline the severance offer?
What reason was given for your termination?
Who made the decision to terminate you?
Were you given advance notice of termination?
Were you provided with a written termination notice?
Did the employer cite performance issues as the reason for termination?
How much time elapsed between your complaint and your termination?
Section 10: Documentation and Evidence: Do you have copies of your performance reviews from 2021, 2022, 2023, and 2024?
Do you have emails or correspondence related to your discrimination complaint?
Do you have your accommodation request in writing?
Do you have medical documentation supporting your disability and accommodation needs?
Do you have emails or communications showing the hostile work environment?
Do you have documentation of job responsibility changes?
Do you have witness statements or contact information for witnesses?
Do you have your original job description?
Do you have documentation of work product or achievements?
Do you have communication records with HR or management?
Do you have any audio or video recordings (if legal in your state)?
Do you have company policies on accommodation or anti-discrimination?
Section 11: Damages and Impact: How has the discrimination and retaliation affected your mental health?
Are you currently seeing a therapist or mental health professional? If yes, who?
Has your medical provider documented emotional distress or mental health impacts?
How has this situation affected your personal relationships (marriage, family)?
Have you experienced specific symptoms (anxiety, depression, PTSD)?
What is your current employment status?
How long were you unemployed after termination?
What income have you lost due to termination?
Have you incurred medical expenses related to the emotional distress?
Have you lost career opportunities or professional reputation?
How has this affected your ability to work in your field?
Have you required medication or treatment for stress-related conditions?
Can family members or friends provide testimony about the impact on you?
What is the total financial impact (lost wages, benefits, medical costs)?
Section 12: Timeline of Key Events: What is the earliest date relevant to your case?
When did each significant event occur (performance reviews, complaint, accommodation request, adverse actions, termination)?
Create a detailed timeline showing the sequence of events.
Note any patterns (e.g., positive reviews before complaint, negative after).
Document the timing between protected activities and adverse actions.
List dates of all communications with HR or management.
Section 13: Comparator Evidence: Were there other employees in similar positions?
How were similarly situated employees without disabilities treated?
Do you know of other employees who made complaints - how were they treated?
Were performance standards applied consistently across employees?
Do you have evidence of disparate treatment?
Section 14: Company's Stated Reasons and: What reasons did the company give for adverse actions?
Were these reasons consistent or did they change over time?
Do you have evidence contradicting the company's stated reasons?
Were the stated reasons applied to other employees similarly?
Can you demonstrate that the reasons are pretextual (false covers for discrimination)?
Were you suddenly criticized for things never mentioned before?
Section 15: Arbitration and Legal Procee: When was mandatory arbitration required by the company?
Did you sign an arbitration agreement? If yes, when?
Was the arbitration clause in your initial employment contract or added later?
When was the mandatory arbitration filing date set (June 2025)?
Have you filed with the EEOC yet? If yes, when?
Have you filed with Texas Workforce Commission yet? If yes, when?
What is your EEOC charge number (if applicable)?
Have you received a right-to-sue letter?
What are the deadlines for your filings (180-300 days from discriminatory act)?
Are you planning to represent yourself pro se or hire an attorney?
Section 16: Desired Outcomes and Demands: What are your primary goals for the good faith meeting with the company?
What remedies are you seeking (reinstatement, back pay, front pay, damages)?
What amount of compensatory damages are you seeking?
Do you want the company to review practices regarding disabled employees?
Do you want policy changes or training implemented?
What would constitute a fair resolution in your view?
Are you open to settlement discussions?
What is your minimum acceptable outcome?
What injunctive relief are you seeking (changes to company practices)?

ADA Failure to Accommodate Claim: 1. Plaintiff is a qualified individual with a disability (autism)
2. The disability and its limitations were known by employer
3. Employer failed to make reasonable accommodations for known limitations
4. Employer failed to engage in good faith interactive process
ADA Retaliation Claim: 1. Plaintiff engaged in protected activity (filed complaint, requested accommodation)
2. Employer took adverse employment action (negative reviews, termination)
3. Causal connection between protected activity and adverse action
4. Timing: adverse actions occurred shortly after protected activity
Disability Discrimination: 1. Plaintiff has a disability under ADA definition
2. Plaintiff is qualified for the position and can perform essential functions with/without accommodation
4. Adverse action occurred because of the disability
Hostile Work Environment: 2. Plaintiff was subjected to unwelcome harassment
3. Harassment was based on disability/protected activity
4. Harassment was severe or pervasive enough to alter conditions of employment
5. Employer knew or should have known and failed to take corrective action
Pretext Evidence: 1. Historical evidence of excellent performance (2021-2023 reviews)
2. Sudden decline in performance ratings after complaint (2024)
3. No prior notice of performance issues
5. Temporal proximity between complaint and adverse actions
6. Disparate treatment compared to similarly situated employees

Investigation and Review Requirements: Full investigation of discrimination and retaliation allegations
Review of all performance reviews from 2021-2024 with explanation of rating changes
Review of all emails and correspondence regarding the 2024 complaint
Review of all accommodation request communications and responses
Explanation of changes in job responsibilities and audit objectives post-complaint
Review of all communications driving removal of work/responsibilities
Comparison analysis of similarly situated employees' treatment
Timeline of all adverse actions following the complaint
Documentation of interactive process attempts (or lack thereof)
Company's policies on disability accommodation and anti-discrimination
Remedies Demanded: Compensatory damages for damage to personal relationships and marriage
Back pay from termination date to present
Front pay for future lost earnings
Reinstatement or front pay in lieu of reinstatement
Restoration of benefits (health insurance, retirement contributions)
Punitive damages for deliberate indifference and gross negligence
Expungement of negative performance reviews and termination from record
Positive reference or neutral reference agreement
Policy and Practice Changes: Independent review of company practices regarding disabled employees
Review of accommodation process and procedures
Training for management on ADA compliance and disability rights
Policy changes to ensure timely response to accommodation requests
Establishment of clear interactive process procedures
Third-party monitoring of discrimination complaint handling
Good Faith Meeting Agenda Items: Presentation of timeline showing correlation between complaint and adverse actions
Presentation of performance review comparison (2021-2023 vs 2024)
Discussion of accommodation request and employer's response/lack thereof
Presentation of evidence of hostile work environment
Discussion of pretext evidence contradicting employer's stated reasons
Opportunity for employer to provide legitimate non-discriminatory explanation
Discussion of potential remedies and settlement options
Discussion of alternative dispute resolution options
Documentation of good faith efforts by both parties
